clinical_study.brief_title: Influence of Inhaled Anaesthetics on Rebreathing of Carbon Dioxide When Using an Anaesthesia Gas Reflector (AnaConDa)
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Inhaled Anaesthetics on Rebreathing of Carbon Dioxide When Using an Anaesthesia Gas Reflector (AnaConDa)

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose is to investigate how the adsorptive capacity of the active carbon filter to carbon dioxide in an anaesthetic gas reflector (AnaConDa) is affected by adding inhaled anaesthetic agent.
The hypothesis is that addition of inhaled anaesthetic agent will affect the amount of adsorption of carbon dioxide to the active carbon and thereby affect rebreathing of carbon dioxide.

primary_outcome.measure: Volume of carbon dioxide rebreathing from an anesthetic gas reflector
primary_outcome.description: Tidal carbon dioxide volume rebreathed from an anesthetic gas reflector correlated to concentration of delivered anesthetic gas.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantification of ventilatory requirements to maintain isocapnia with the use of an anesthetic gas reflector.
secondary_outcome.description: Changes of tidal volume required to maintain constant alveolar ventilation will be assessed by continuous measurement of exhaled tidal carbon dioxide volume, the latter to be maintained at a constant value.

arm_group.description: The group where the investigators adds inhaled anaesthetic agent when using the anaesthetic gas reflector (AnaConda).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- elective coronary artery by-pass graft surgery
- elective valve replacement surgery
- normal left ventricular ejection fraction on preoperative echocardiography
Exclusion Criteria:
- obstructive lung disease
- restrictive lung disease
